entities.name: bellatrix

entities.name: potter
entities.description: Potter is mentioned as being foolish and gallant, implying he has a certain level of importance or significance in the story. ("Potter, that was foolish! Potter, I — that was very — very gallant of you")

relationships.description: Harry understands what Bellatrix meant, implying a relationship between the two. ("I see what Bellatrix meant")
Professor McGonagall is concerned about Potter's arrival, implying a relationship between the two. ("Potter! Potter — you're here!")
Harry defended Potter by saying he spat at Professor McGonagall, implying a relationship between Harry and Potter. ("He spat at you")
